meanings.definition: To mentally prepare oneself for a task or challenge.
meanings.sent1: Before the big game, he was psyching himself up by listening to pump-up music.
meanings.sent2: She was psyching herself for the presentation by taking deep breaths and visualizing success.
meanings.sent3: The student was psyching himself up to ask his crush to the school dance.
meanings.sent4: The actor was psyching himself up backstage before going on for the final scene.
meanings.sent5: Psyching yourself before a speech can help boost your confidence and performance.

meanings.definition: To intimidate or manipulate someone psychologically.
meanings.sent1: The bully was psyching his classmates by spreading rumors about them.
meanings.sent2: She was psyching her opponent by staring intensely into their eyes during the match.
meanings.sent3: The villain was psyching the hero by revealing his secret weakness.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was psyching his victims into giving him their money.
meanings.sent5: Psyching someone through fear tactics is not a respectful way to interact.

meanings.definition: The act of using psychological tactics to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent1: In negotiations, he relied on psyching to outsmart his opponents.
meanings.sent2: The team's success was partly due to their effective psyching strategies.
meanings.sent3: The politician's psyching tactics were both cunning and controversial.
meanings.sent4: The coach's psyching of the players motivated them to perform at their best.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the art of psyching can give you an edge in competitive situations.
